contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather, so let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, the first heatwave advisory of the year has been issued in the southern part of the country. On top of that, the UV ray index is soaring.

Right, Conn-young. It’s only the beginning of June, but the temperatures are almost like mid-summer. The first heatwave advisories of the year have been issued in parts of the Gyeongsang-do provinces, and this morning those were expanded to Jeollanam-do province. Heatwave advisories mean people should take precautions for their health, especially at-risk groups like kids and senior citizens. So please make sure to stay hydrated at all times.

For tomorrow, dense fog is likely to develop along the west coast, so please be extra careful out on the roads. The UV ray index will continue to stay at ‘very high’ levels all across the nation, so do wear plenty of sunblock as well.

We’ll start off with sunny spells with Seoul at 18 degrees and Daegu 21.

Daytime highs will hover between 26 and 32 degrees. Daegu will be sweltering hot at 34 degrees.

The heat in the southern region will ease for the weekend, but in the west, temperatures will rise back up starting on Saturday.

For Korea's neighbors, both Tokyo and Beijing will also see very high levels of UV rays.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Clear spells tomorrow...heatwave advisory expanded in Southern regions
Updated: 2020-06-04 17:00:34 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon, the season's first heat wave advisory is in place for Daegu and parts of the Gyeongsang-do Provinces with the mercury expected to hover in the mid 30's under blazing sunshine.

Those in regions with readings above 30 degrees will need to slow down on caffeinated drinks. Instead, drink plenty of water. Young children and senior citizens need special care during a heat wave. Avoid outdoor activities between noon and 4 PM.

But this mini heatwave won't sweep the entire country, the capital areas will have top readings a couple degrees lower than yesterday. In the mid twenties this afternoon. Skies will get brighter and strong sunshine and UV levels will beam down on us.

Warm and sunny weather will persist for the time being. Highs will jump to the 30s in Seoul, morning lows will also rise to the twenties.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com

contents.headline:
Season's first heat wave alerts in Daegu, sunny skies during the day
Updated: 2020-06-04 07:11:57 KST

contents.context:
Good morning, those in Daegu and parts of the Gyeongsang-do Provinces will need to prepare for extreme heat today. The season's first heat wave advisory is issued with temperatures expected to hover in the mid 30's under blazing sunshine.

Babies and young children as well as your pet and plants need special care during a heat wave, and slow down on caffeinated drinks. Instead, drink plenty of water.

Some cloud coverage to start the day in upper regions with a chance of passing sprinkles, lows are a couple notches higher than the same time yesterday.

Highs in Daegu and Gyeongju will be 35 degrees Celsius while Seoul will have top readings a couple degrees lower than yesterday at 26 degrees Celsius. Plenty of sunshine will shine down all day.

It could get hotter in Seoul from Saturday, which is Memorial Day in Korea. Sunny skies will continue to shine down.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Heat wave alerts in Daegu under strong sunshine
Updated: 2020-06-04 05:56:52 KST

contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather, so let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, today was hotter than yesterday in the capital. Also, heatwave advisories have been issued in some southern regions. What more can you tell us?

Right, Conn-young. And this sizzling heat will continue throughout the nation. The first heatwave advisories of the year have been issued in Gyeongsangbuk-do and Gyeongsangnam-do Provinces and in the city of Daegu. These advisories will take effect from 11 am tomorrow. Normally, heatwave advisories are issued when body temperatures have the potential to exceed 33 degrees Celsius for two consecutive days.

Southern regions will continue to stay baking hot for the week with daytime highs of over 30 degrees.

Also, the UV ray index will continue to stay at 'very high' levels nationwide excluding Suwon city. Sunburn can take as little as 10 minutes, so refrain from outdoor activities if possible.

Tomorrow, Seoul will start off warm at 19 degrees, Gwangju and Daegu at 20 degrees.

Daytime temperatures will be a bit cooler in the capital with 26 degrees. In Daegu and Gyeongju, expect scorching highs of 34 degrees.

For Korea's neighbors, Beijing will reach up to 29 degrees with very high UV ray levels, so please wear plenty of sunblock.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Daytime highs to hover 30 degrees nationwide…high levels of UV rays
Updated: 2020-06-03 17:11:43 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon, brace for a hot summer like day. In the capital will see the high rising 6 degrees more than yesterday. Those of you in Daegu and its surrounding regions will have highs we normally see at the end of July.

We kicked off the day under plenty of clouds but skies will get sunnier as we head into the afternoon and UV levels will be very high in most regions except on Jeju where spotty rain could fall during the day.

It's going to be a bright and sweltering afternoon, so keeping a face mask on during the day will be real challengetry to take it easy today and drink plenty of water.

Highs in Seoul will hike to 30 from this weekend and the heat wave will carry on into early next week while skies will feature plenty of sunshine and there will be very little in the way of clouds.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com

contents.headline:
Hot summer afternoon under ample sunshine
Updated: 2020-06-03 07:12:25 KST

contents.context:
Good morning, it's going to be a hot summer like day. In the capital will see the high rising 6 degrees more than yesterday. Those of you in Daegu will have highs we normally see at the end of July. So brace for a hot summer afternoon.

This morning, we are kicking off the day under plenty of clouds and lows are a few notches higher than the same time yesterday, ranging from 17 to 20 degrees Celsius.

Highs will soar to the upper 20's to low 30's. Daegu and Gyeongju will get up to 31 and 32 degrees this afternoon, skies will get sunnier as we head into the afternoon.
Jeju could see some spotty rain during the day.

Highs in Seoul will hover around 30 degrees by the weekend while sunny skies will continue to dominate most regions.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.

contents.headline:
Morning cool, hot and sunny afternoon...feeling more like late July in Daegu
Updated: 2020-06-03 06:08:46 KST

contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather, so let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, rain in the capital area has eased but it's currently raining in some central regions and inland areas. These showers are expected to continue until dawn tomorrow. What can you tell us about that?

Right, Conn-young. Rainclouds have formulated in central regions and they've now expanded throughout Jeollabuk-do and Gyeongsangbuk-do provinces. The amount of rain forecasted is 5 to 20 mm in central regions. Elsewhere, less than 5mm is expected and rain is due last until tomorrow morning.

But in areas where no rain is in forecast, temperatures are to soar to above 30 degrees Celsius tomorrow. In the latter half of the week, Seoul will also be seeing highs close to 30 degrees.

Amid tomorrow's sunny spells, the UV ray index will soar to ‘very high’ levels in most of the nation, so do wear plenty of sunblock. The Meteorological Administration advises you to avoid outdoor activities from 10 am to 3 pm.

Tomorrow, Seoul will begin the day at 17 degrees, Daegu and Busan at 18.

Daytime temperatures will be higher than today's with Seoul at 27, Daegu 31 and Busan 25.

For Korea's neighbors, Tokyo will see highs of 29 degrees with periodic clouds.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Cloudy and rainy in central region, sweltering highs in the south
Updated: 2020-06-02 17:14:20 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon, those of us in the central part of the country will have the exact opposite weather pattern today, murky skies with rain. The further west you are, the more rainfall, you'll receive. Seoul will also see rain around lunch time through tomorrow dawn with 5 to 20 millimeters of precipitation in the forecast.

So rain affected regions will have readings lower than yesterday, but Daegu and its surrounding regions will have another blisteringly hot day.

Highs in Gyeongju and Daegu will be 30 degrees, Gwangju at 29, mostly sunny skies could add more warmth to the air, while Daejeon will be warm and rainy.

Seoul will also notice temperatures rising day by day and by Sunday, highs will soar to 30 degrees Celsius while there will be light rain again on Thursday for the central region.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com
